text: Expect this place to be packed EVERY SINGLE time you visit. The food is that good. The coffee cake alone is worth the wait.

I was really hoping for this place to be good, too bad I didn't even get to eat. My girlfriend, uncle and I were seating down waiting to get service but that service never arrived. We waited for at least 13 minutes and no one ever came to ask us if we needed? water, food or anything. If they would have been busy or if there would have been not enough employees, I would understand. But that was not the case, they had plenty of workers and the place was not full at all. Every body else around us were getting served no problem, we decided to leave since no one really cared to talk to us. When we were walking out, no one and if there was anything wrong or anything, they just looked at us like whatever. Total disappointment, I will tell all my friends and family about the lack of service

First time here but what could possibly be bad at a place that offers you the choice between toast or frigging coffee cake!!??? 

BTW,  the best coffee cake  ever. 

The coffee was delish too. 

Just waiting for the mains to finish this place off... 

They're very crowded on a late Sunday morning so service is a little slow. 

OK,  wait is over food is here..... 

AND IT IS GOOD.......   Gotta go...  Food calls.

First time here. Heard so much about this place we had to try. I was, sadly disappointed. First the service was not that great. I ordered the blue berry pancakes and they were dry. I asked, twice for additional syrup and by the time I got it my pancakes were cold. They weren't that good to begin with.

This is not the same flavor & preparation as the green valley location!! Everything was over cooked or burnt! If I didn't know better than I would never eat at cracked egg again!!! Stay away from this branch!!!! The rainbow & green valley are the best!

Was pretty excited that a Cracked Egg was in close by my work. Thought I'd stop in. No wait, place was pretty nice, it's newer so everything is nice and shiny. Took about less than a minute to get our drink order but over 4 to get our waitress back to our table. She was tall, thin, short curly hair. She was ok, took order, told us our food would be awhile. DOn't know why, but ours took longer than everyone around us, we just ordered eggs and bacon with toast :/  finally got our food. It was nothing special. Had better, had worse. The only saving grace was the 2 for 1 coupon. Haven't been back. Probably wont be either.

How many times can you say YUM during one meal? too many to count!
Everything on the menu here is great. Never too much butter/oil and always leaves you full but not sick to your stomach. Waiting staff is always very nice and accommodating to all special needs. 
I would recommend all of the omelettes and the french toast for first timers. 
Oh and the coffee is surprisingly good.
Keep up the good work!

Seasonal Coffee Cakes...Oh My Goodness.....Love this place!

Atmosphere:
It has a very upbeat vibe. The pictures on the wall sets the mood for great conversations and deep questionings...what came first ..the chicken or the Egg? Seriously, the question did come up! There are pics of chicken and eggs in the Cracked Egg, as well as the picture hanging over my table which read, "BE NICE or LEAVE...THANK YOU". So the atmosphere was great. 

Very well Attended:
We noticed that there were a lot of people there on a Wednesday morning at 9 am, which is a great sign so we ventured in. What really drew me there was the potential of having Pumpkin Coffee Cake. Unfortunately for me, that doesn't start until next month. I was informed that OCTOBER IS PUMPKIN MONTH! YaY! I'll be Back! 

Fortunately for me, I did try the hot Apple Cinnamon coffee cake and that was so delicious and hot out of the oven.

I ordered a basic skillet meal which was delicious and very filling. I had to take half the food home..maybe the coffee cake was the culprit, but seriously, one must have cake first!

Wait Staff: Attentive
The overall experience was really sweet. Great people watching, plenty of tables and really sweet wait staff. My coffee was always warm.. I will return for that Pumpkin Coffee Cake for sure!! 

Great place..give it a try.
Eggs and pancakes are fine here, but I branched out to the Monte Cristo today, and it was not just not good--it was GROSS. I'm so bummed and want my money back.
Good Service. Pleasantly surprised with the food.

Come often and come HUNGRY.
I grew up in New York coffee shops and Diners... If you want a taste of heaven, this is Vegas'
answer to what you'd expect.
The quality and service is excellent  
The pancakes are delicious.  Very large portions. Can stand up to anything in NY!
As a 25 year resident and local doctor I stand by these words.
Dr. Jay Selznick.  702 436-9090.
Can't wait until breakfast.
Bon appetite.
Drjselznick.com

My husband and I have been coming here since they opened. We have never had a bad experience. The food is always great and the service is always on point. I often mentioned to my husband that I never see a manager around. Everyone is dressed the same and always busy refilling coffee for customers, running food, rolling silverware, etc. The last time we were there we were checking out up front and my husband asked where the manager was. The woman who was checking us out WAS the manager!  I almost fell over. She was one I noticed refilling coffees and running food and rolling silverware! Talk about teamwork!!! I work at a restaurant where the managers won't move from the front of  the soda fountain when your trying to get drinks for your tables, much less run food or roll silver! I am so impressed with place!!

Decided to try the The Cracked Egg because of their gluten-free offerings but was disappointed.  Husband & I had lunch and then gave another try at breakfast the next morning.  Not wonderful either time.  GF pancakes were not cooked all the way through leaving gooey middle.  Lunch had problems as well.  Service was not the best either.

Customer service is terrible at this location. We waited 20 minutes to be seated. Two customers came in a couple minutes after us and were seated before us. Needless to say we walked off and will not be coming here again.

Start your day off right!!! Food is fantastic!!! Nice new store close to Red Rock casino. Breakfast is my favorite meal and never disappointed here. Staff is great, funny, fun yet professional. My all time favorite server is Rhonda, the tall blonde she's quite witty and always make me/us laugh!

I definately would come here again, the service is great (she wanted to add me on snapchat) and the food it great. It is the perfect size and it is a great welcoming restaurant. I would prefer THE MONTE CRISTO, a ham and swiss cheese sandwich coated in french toast batter, and deep fried. 10/10 would totally recommend!!!

I placed a to go order at 932am today by the time I arrived at the location at 950am our food was ready. The hostess greeted me as I walked in, told her my name, paid my ticket and drove back home. The easiest most convenient morning this week. The food was hot and very tasty. I will continue business with them.

Closer to a 3 1/2.  Bring your appetite....the servings are big.  Depending on your hunger level...you could get 2 orders for 3 people.
The service was excellent, the place clean and the brea,kfast was very good...coffee was decent.
The crumb cake thing is a little overrated but was a nice change over toast....if you have it I would skip pancakes and french toast as the sweets and carbs would be overkill.   We had pancakes, french toast, omelet and a skillet....the egg dishes shined more than the others.  Great for brunch too.  No idea how the sandwich/lunch menu is.  ENJOY.
This was the first time and boy really good hot food even eating outside.We definitely had the best server SHARON .She is the best!!!!'

I love having breakfast here and the food is really good. The Veggie Bennie is my fav, but I always do it with scrambled eggs instead of poached. The only thing that holds me back from giving 5 stars is that when sitting outside, the service is much slower. Other than that this place is great.

This is the second time I've been here, and it's amazing.
The staff is friendly and the service is great. The first time I had the PB stuffed French toast, without the honey because I like syrup.  It was fantastic!  Today I had the Joes scramble with sausage instead of hamburger. Again fantastic. My kids did not want to come here because they don't like eggs, but I made them:)
They both had the croissant French toast and said it was the best French toast (besides mine) that they'd ever had!
I could tell this restaurant was popular with locals by the crowd that was there on a weekday.  They fixed our breakfast perfectly.  I can't wait to go back to Las Vegas so I can eat there again.
Great breakfast place.   Our food was delivered hot and quickly.  The servers we met were very nice and attentive.  We will certainly go back.

I came in half an hour before they closed. The first thing the hostess says to me is they close in 30 rather than greeting us. Within two minutes of sitting down the waitress in the next section over is talking horribly about the table across from us with one of the managers. Hopefully they reevaluate their customer service skills and take their personal opinions in the kitchen next time instead of in front of their guests

Amazing food, the French fries are the best I've ever had, great prices ! I will return. Service was great, was seated in about 10mins on a busy Sunday after noon.! Thank you! 
No wifi. Which is actually a plus, I actually got to have a nice convo with family .

I have been to several of the cracked egg locations and have never had anything but a great experience. I personally prefer to go to local family owned establishments like this one. I love to get the peanut butter stuffed french toast. I also like to get the build your own skillet because the variety of options they have. I noticed somebody wrote a tip about it but it is worth repeating that their coffee cake is excellent. I might be addicted to it as I can't prevent myself from ordering it whenever I come to the cracked egg. My favorite one to get when it is available is the peanut butter one but they all are good. Over the years I have tried the majority of options they have had on their menu and was always satisfied. This new location is no different. Keep up the good work!
I finally found a great place to eat breakfast. The skillet breakfast is my favorite. I'm definitely eating here more often

Great service! Everyone here gives great service.  Most of the food here is very good.  I recommend everyone to try it out at least 1 time and  I promise you will not be disappointed.  I love this place.

Great restaurant   We called. Ahead to see what the wait time was an it was only 15 minutes for Mother's Day morning    The start you off with a bunn cake /Danish they were quick to take your order and it didn't take long to arrive. Victoria our server did a great job and help make recommendations.
Went during mothers day and the wait time was not long at all, everyone was very accommodating and polite. Service was fast and efficient, and we enjoyed the food. Will definitely come back again!
Didn't know where to go off the 215 and saw this place. Even tho it's 1.6 miles off the freeway. It's easy to get there. Excellent food and friendly people. I recommend it. We had breakfast.

This place is Amazing. We recently tried out the Charleston Blvd location on a Sunday it was crowded but it was only 15 mins wait for a table. 

The food was amazing! And big portions! Don't forget the coffee cake oh my that is to die for.

I had the chicken fried steak and my bf some sort of omelette. 

Will def come back again. Only complain was I ordered a tea and pot where they put extra hot water had a paper in it idk how it get there or why our waiter didn't see it when she filled it out with water. Either way I didn't get charge for it. Only complaint I have otherwise this place would have been 5 star.
I came here for breakfast with my volleyball team at 6 in the morning and our food came at 7. The wait was horrific but the food is great. Great enough to wait an hour? Undeclared.

I generally like to give small businesses the benefit of the doubt, and tend to write reviews based only on positive experiences, as once can see from my reviews. However, there was one particular aspect of having breakfast here that has induced me to write a very negative review. The food (and the quality of the food for the value) was pretty mediocre, which would normally earn about a 3 star review from me. But my experience with a staff member working the cash register has earned this location something else. After finishing my breakfast, never having dined here before, I was unsure if I was supposed to pay the check to my waitress at the table, or I was expected to carry the check up to the cash register myself to pay. After waiting at the table for 5-10 minutes, I reckoned I should walk the check up to the front counter to pay. Upon reaching the cash register, I asked a young woman in her twenties behind the counter  - "should I pay here?" - to which she promptly replied while motioning back toward the rear of the restaurant - "No, you should pay it back there - in the bathroom." Okay, a young aspiring comedienne, not smiling at all, deadpan delivery, got it. I shrugged the comment off, smiled, and proceeded to pay the check. Upon completing the transaction, she once again went for the jugular - "Next time you come here, pay the check in the bathroom, see how far that gets you." Okay, that was a little bit TOO rude, inappropriate, and no longer funny by anyone's standards. While I was driving away, I was a little bit stunned that someone would be so pointedly mean-spirited not once, but twice. I contemplated driving back there and berating this young woman, but decided against it, vowing only never to frequent the restaurant again. Management should absolutely dismiss her. One or two of her fellow women coworkers were within earshot of this whole episode, and likely recall it, should management wish to take action.

Eggggg-cellent service, good food, good prices. Server was able to grab me the last piece of pumpkin coffee cake even though they ran out, it was a corner piece that I figure they couldn't sell so she gave it to me free of charge. What a sweetie! That's a winner in my book!

My eggs were prepared just right.   Our server knew the menu pretty well and made suggestions which is always appreciated and we received service with a smile, that always makes the food taste better. Lol

I want to put less than 1 star I didn't even have a chance to sit down and look at the menu when I was rudely turned away from the establishment because I had my dogs with me. Now I wasn't trying to sit inside, I was getting a table on the patio and have my dogs on the outside of the rail. The man said he was the owner, we'll I wish him the worst.

Love the way they have their menu and the  yellow card you have next to you that signals waitress if you need service.  The staff is friendly and  so helpful with recommendations  . This place never fails 
Is clean and affordable.

Service was great, food came out pretty fast. You really want to try their delicious coffee cake! The omelette I order was okay, food presentation can definitely improve. Overall, it was a good breakfast place.

Super good. People are friendly and everything on the menu has been good. Neither of their potato options are all that great (IMHO) but everything else I've gotten there has been great. All of the Cracked Egg locations get VERY crowded at peak times, so get there early. 

They have no wifi there (kinda there thing) so bring your own or "Talk to each other..."
Amazing food and great service. Enjoyed the Greek omelet and love the surprise of a different coffee cake.

I was very irate with the staff as they do not know what the laws are when it come to service animals at this establishment, My friend who is a Gulf War Vet has a service dog for his PTSD, and was treated very rudely at this eatablishment.  I have been here numerous times, but never again and I will be sure to voice my opinion to everyone i meet.  We went to sit on the patio on a slow day and were told to leave and when we informed them that the dog was a service animal they said they needed proof, He then told them that that they were not allowed to ask for papers, and what kind of service animal he is and  tried to inform them that the 2 questions they were able to ask, "Is that a servcie dog?" "What has he been trained to do?"  the waitress walked away from us before he could finish..  I WAS SO IRATE AT OUR TREATMENT we decided to go else where to spend our money.  The fact that they have not trained their staff is no excuse.  I am more upset at this than my friend is.  They should take the time to review the Americans with Disabilities Act. Ignorance is no excuse.   The thing I was looking forward to this morning was the fresh coffe cake that they serve, but it is not enough to bring us back, and a fresh doughnut from Krispy Kreams is worth the drive, and they gave my friend some water in a bowl for his service animal as we had our doughnut.

This place was great!! It was the firs time trying for my fiance & I.  Our server gave great suggestions on what to get and our food was delivered super quick after ordering.  I got the crossant breakfast sandwich & my man got the pancakes with a side of kicken potatoes with eggs on top.  Would recommend to any breakfast lover! We'll be back

Met with a friend for breakfast, first time to this location and I liked that it wasn't crazy busy like it would be on a weekend. Our waitress was attentive and nice. I got a mix up with my order but she immediately fixed it. I got the California omelette, it was tasty but I wish they cut the bacon into prices rather than have two big strips in it to where u have to use a butter knife to cut it to pieces. The coffee cake was good, I just didn't have a sweet tooth at the moment. Overall all experience was pleasant.

This place only gets a single star and that's only because our waitress was so kind. We were excited to come to this new location. Came after a walk with my friends and small dog. We sat on the patio and ordered. When the waitress was finishing our order she informed us we could not stay with our dog. We said okay we'll put her on the other side of the railing. She informed us she didn't think we could do that either. I informed her at other restaurants as long as the dog wasn't in their "dinning area" it should be okay. She left to ask the manager. The owner came out.....actually stood in the door way. In a very curt tone informed us I'm not serving you. I don't care what side the dog is on. No apology nor any sound of remorse or empathy in his voice. I see now why you and your partner have problems.  We left and had a lovely pet friendly breakfast at EGG WORKS

The hostess is completely scattered brain and rude. I understand this is a busy place for breakfast but I called and placed a order to go at 1:00pm and by the time I got there she never even put it in the system and told me that no one ever called. I showed her proof on my phone and then the next thing you know the manager came up and saw my order written down on the order slip. A little aggravated she then all a sudden remembered me calling and apologized. I work at a restaurant 10 x busier than this place and a mistake like this is very unprofessional. I hope they work on this or get a more suitable host.
Cracked egg has  perfectly made hash brown. Staff is friendly and food is yummy. One of my favorite breakfast spots in Summerlin.
The Californian Omelette with freshly squeezed orange juice is amazing!!!! Great place to hang out and have breakfast. Try their coffee cake too!

For the best breakfast selection served with their fresh homemade muffins, this is the place to go in Las Vegas. They have several locations and I've been to them all. The food is excellent and the service the same.

After my second visit I'm finally writing a review. If you're visiting from out of town or a local this is the spot for breakfast. It's about a 2 minute drive down Charleston from the Red Rock Resort and just a few minutes from Badlands golf course. 

On this visit I brought my family. My son was begging for room service but since he decided to wake up at 6 am I decided to drag them out for a real breakfast. Service was excellent! Ordered drinks and they were out before I could check in on yelp. The coffee here is really good. I like the mugs they serve in. 

Kids menu is simple and all of the items are inexpensive. The kids each wanted an order of chocolate chip pancakes but I think they could have split an order because the pancakes are a good size and dense; 7 yr old had 1 and 5 yr old had .75 of 1. 

Wife ordered the garden veggie omelette, $9.85. Comes with choice of hash browns or house potatoes, and choice of toast or coffee cake. Do yourself a favor and splurge on the coffee cake. It's a whole lot of food. I went with the sweet potato skillet, $10.75. Has the same options as the aforementioned meal. All that food was only $41+$10 tip. One of my favorite breakfast spots.

Right now the coffee cake has gingerbread cream cheese filling, probably a seasonal thing because of Xmas time. Last time I was here in summer the regular coffee was just as good. 

Stop by for breakfast if you are hanging out by red rock. They do have several of these establishments around Vegas. Hope you get to try it out. Happy eating!

I honestly wanted to love this place, but the food was very underwhelming.  I ordered eggs, bacon and hash browns. I found myself piling on the salt and pepper to give it flavor. My boyfriend ordered the south shore scramble with egg whites. His ended up being mainly cheese and chicken. The portions were decent sized but they lacked substance and flavor. My hash browns were a tad greasy and sat very heavy in my stomach all day. Bacon was too crispy. The customer service was good though. 

There's too many unique breakfast places in Vegas to go back to the Cracked Egg. 

I'm giving it a solid 3 stars because it's a basic breakfast. It wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great.

Just moved to the area... 3 people at the desk when we walked in. The woman who greeted us was not exactly welcoming off friendly. Said hold on after asking us so how many?
I'm like good morning to you too.... 
There was a cute brown haired girl that has just started... She helped buffer that abrasiveness and was smiling and asked us how our day was going. ... GOOD JOB GIRL! ... I told the front, I think your employee needs a tab bit of training in customer service... As this is summerlin and I just moved here and first impressions are everything! ..... Went and ate at the bar in back... Service was EXCELLeNT and the food was delicious!!!!!! 

The MANAGER delivered our food and apologized... Well Played! Well Played! ...And we chatted for a bit. She's running a great Resturant!!!! I was very impressed with their quick response to my issue!! 

Wonderful! And I'll definately be back!

The food was good, the service was okay... you could tell the server judged me based off of my color. I hate when I walk into a place and people judge me before they even know who I am. It's truly hurtful. I am there to take my grandmother out to eat and I feel as though I am cut off or a burden to the establishment because people do not know how to talk to me. I don't like the cracked egg off of Charleston... the one off of Cheyenne is amazing and such a beautiful place. The energy is great and people love to do their job. Now at this one, everyone did their job but you could see they were not happy. It was like working in Mother's Day was a drag. By the end of the meal the server lightened up a bit. It was not enough to have my opinion changed. I think if I was to go to the cracked egg the one on Cheyenne is where I would go. The one on Charleston's does not know manners and how to excuses themselves when walking in front of someone. Did it blatantly and more than one time. Rushing and almost knocking my grandmothers purse on the floor. You can run an establishment without rushing. Customer service is everything.

Everything here is delicious! My only complaint is that sometimes service can be slow or there's a long wait on weekends, but that tends to happen everywhere on weekends in Vegas. My first love is the Veggie Benny with bacon added, but I've tried many different entrees here and each have been so tasty and cooked perfectly. Also try the montecristo or the croissant French toast. They're both amazing!

I am kind of neutral on this place. Came here at 7 am before a hike and it was pretty dead , which was nice! Previously when I came we had to wait a half hour so definitely come early if it's sat or sun. This time around I just ordered a two egg breakfast, but didn't realize that doesn't come with meat as a typical two egg breakfast does. Besides that disappointing factor my food was nothing special. It did come out fast and maybe I should try something more interesting next time but I just wasn't all that impressed with my meal. The service was fast and the waitress was friendly though.

I really love this restaurant, their food is amazing! I always have the cracked croissant and a side of coffee cake, and they're delicious. I've had their biscuit with gravy and it is by far the best side I've had in awhile. I'm a big fan of breakfast joints and think this one is by far one of the  best I have been too in a very long time. I highly recommend it.

Been living here for 3 months and finally tried this place with my mom. Waited as long as the hostess said - 15 minutes. It's definitely a well known place for breakfast because of how busy it was. It was a fast pace restaurant, got our food within 15 minutes after ordering. I will definitely be back. A good portion of food for 1 person. :)
Medium wait, fast hot coffee, good food....what can you say, it's breakfast for the champions. The Greek Omlette, French Toast and short stack all received thumbs up.
Food was good very busy on weekends had a 15min wait the service was nice friendly environment
Best home-cooked breakfast in the neighborhood, and a welcome new addition to this corner of the city.

Excellent breakfast with Andi as our server. The orange cream coffee cake was to die for, and our entrees arrived very quickly. All of the food was served hot. I was very, very happy with our meal there this morning.

Andi was truly sweet, kind and helpful.

Amazing Experience! We were driving by looking for a place to eat breakfast and found this place so we thought we would try it. My family was sooo impressed. Service was fast. The food was delish! And service was awesome. My youngest son even said that "it was the best breakfast he had ever had"! We went back the next day and although it was busier that day, the service & food were the same....GREAT! What a great find!! When we come to Vegas, we will always come by this spot. Yummy!
Great food, good service. The "Veggie Benny" was delicious! (Only complaint- the waitress forgot to bring us more coffee).

| I take my cream and sugar with a hint of coffee! |
Coffee is always fresh. Orange Juice is always fresh. Took on the chocolate banana pancakes and my partnah in crime had the sausage, crispy hash brown , and over easy eggs. Add the coffee cake and pow... It's a power breakfast! Everything was superb. I love this joint!

This is my new favorite breakfast spot when I visit Vegas ! Came on a Saturday morning , service was great and my meal was so good ! I had the Scrambled Eggs with Pesto spinach and feta cheese and it was delicious !! Also their side of potatoes were so amazing , ate every one !!

Plan for a wait on the weekends but it goes fast. The outside patio is nice if the weather is good. Food is typical breakfast eats but done well. My favorite is the corned beef hash - real corned beef and hashbrowns. I add the chorizo for some spice. Coffee cake is amazing, as are the seasoned potatoes.

Updated 7/5. By the way, after finally trying out a dish that was labelled similarly at its competition "The Egg and I", I was sorely disappointed in their version. Way to win the battle of the breakfast!
Excellent service and great food.  I sat at the counter with a friend, we had steak and eggs.  The breakfast was fantastic, with super attention. I will return, as well as recommend.

Very basic breakfast, service at this place is horrible,,,do not sit outside, been there twice and same horrible service both times, coffee empty, bussers walking by not helping out.  I had to go to the host to get some attention to the table.  You can certainly do better than this place for breakfast.
Great breakfast place in Nevada. Fruit plate is fab! Sometimes you just don't know when it comes to fruit

The Cracked Egg recently opened in Summerlin. There was a line out the door the morning we were there. The food was serviceable, but no dish stood out as something special. I had the low fat special. Which had chicken, green chilies, red salsa and tortilla chips. It tasted okay but did not look very appetizing on the plate.  It looked like a pinkish mash. The tortilla chips were also mushy. It seemed like they were trying to make a healthier version of chilaquiles, but the execution was so so. Still, it was eatable. My husband had the carnitas omelette which was fine. Our friends two of the skillets and the eggs Benedict. All of which were also fine. The best part of the meal was the coffee cake that they offer as a side. It's served warm with a sugar glaze on top. This place is an okay breakfast option if your favorite place is too packed. I think the wait that we experienced was because this is a new place. The crowds will die down after it's been open a while.

Had the Tropical French Toast today. It was HUGE! No way I could even eat half of it. Highly suggest sharing. I wonder of they offer half portions.... But it was tasty. Loaded with toasted coconut, and a sliced whole banana.

Oh my gosh food here is great. They have the best orange juice in the world lol!  Service is good. It's busy on weekends but the wait for a small party is not too bad. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs, it was delicious.. That orange though gave me life! Def coming back to pig out some more:)

Breakfast. Need I say more? 

The wait was minimal for a weekend but the place was busy.  The food arrived quickly. 

Now for the food - it was you typical breakfast place. Nothing outstanding. Just good food. I was happy to get rye bread for toast. My SIL got the coffee
Cake and was surprised that it was essentially a piece of red velvet cake with a coffee cake icing. It tasted good but one couldn't eat much of it. 

If you need a quick breakfast where you will be served quickly and the food will be a solid good, then this is the place for you.

First time here got burnt toast, fake butter, watered down coffee, omelet was flat as a pancake and hurry up and leave service. With so many great options near by I think I will choose something else next time.

We each out a fair amount and this place is always great. Very accommodating to our special orders. Coffee is always hot and great customer service to keep our cups full! Our children prefer brunch and they have wonderful soups and salads as well as lots of breakfast foods!!

Had the veggie benny! It was good! Im super picky and I enjoyed it heavy on the spin tho. I love this location. Last time we were here we chatted w our waiter about his dentist! My boyfriend loves the coffee cake

Had the Monte Cristo yesterday!!! Talk about AMAZING!!! One of the best sandwiches I have ever had!! Maybe because it was dipped in French toast batter and deep fried! LOL! SO GOOD! Must try!!!  Waitress was great! Food came out quickly as well!

The cracked croissant is to die for. I love to come here every now and then because you don't have to wait ridiculous amount of time for a booth/table compared to other breakfast places. Service is always good here, and they also have outdoor seating which is a plus. Food is amazing all my friends love this place. 5 stars.
I am so glad they offer a separate menu for gluten sensitive folks like me. This is a very rare thing. Thank you, Cracked Egg! Good coffee too!

Been here a couple times with my Celiac wife.  They have a legit gluten sensitive menu, although they do share a fryer and toaster. But, they tell you that.  For those that choose GF, you'll maybe not care about the toaster. Wifey just skips the cross-contaminated items and enjoys her meal every time.  Just learned today that in place of their coffee cake which comes with every order, you can not only get the cross contaminated toast, but hey have udi's choc-choc or blueberry muffin. Everyone has always been friendly, prices fair, good food, Celiac friendly.
This place is cute and easy. The food is great, space is clean, and staff was really nice. The Huevos Rancheros are great! I can't wait to come back for an easy meal.
Love this place. It's my go to breakfast place. I recommend the chili skillet, California omelet, French toast... Everything is delicious. Service is fast and friendly.

My Review For/Of The Cracked Egg  
The Place Is Absolutely Wonderful To Go Have Breakfast  & (And) Lunch . The Service Is Wonderful, The Employees/Workers Do Such A Great Job There Every Day, The Chairs/Seats Are Always Clean, The Menu Selections Are Good/Great & (And) Everything Else Important (Etc.).
Always 4 Stars .. Breakfast is always delicious.  I always  request extra crispy hashbrowns.  Hit & miss on service and wait time ... Ty to go around 6:30-7:30 am no wait then :)

I was a little apprehensive about visiting The Cracked Egg since many of the reviews so far weren't so good. I'd been watching the construction of this restaurant since it is very close to my job and I frequent some of the other businesses in the area.

Luckily, either I visited at a good time of day, or they worked out the initial kinks in service, because I had a lovely experience.  The restaurant is bright and cheerful, with a semi-open kitchen. There are several large booths and tables throughout, as well as patio seating (no dogs allowed, the sign is pretty prominent). 

I was seated promptly, my drink order was taken right away, and my server checked on me throughout the meal. I enjoyed my Californian omelette, which was served with a choice of home fries, hash browns, or fruit along with a choice of toast or coffee cake. Next time, I will definitely get the coffee cake, because it looked great. I was able to sample a piece (my friend got the coffee cake), and it was really yummy. Apparently, they have different varieties daily. Prices were reasonable, with most items averaging between $10-$12.

I expect that The Cracked Egg gets really busy on the weekends, and the parking situation was already pretty tight because there are so many other businesses nearby. It is nice having a breakfast/brunch option in Summerlin!
The ambiance is okay, prices are a little high for what they offer. Service is polite and food is tasty. Probably will not be back.

Stopped in on a Saturday morning after a hike at Red Rock Canyon. Glad we did! Seated immediately. Hostess was friendly. Waitress came and asked if we had any questions which she answered expertly and patiently. Our food came quickly and was close to perfect. I had the Veggie Benedict and my bff/husband had a tuna melt. Fabulous on all accounts. Entrees run about $10 on average. We left very satisfied and look forward to returning and trying the coffee cake which comes in different varieties throughout the day.

Our waitress was 5 star. We ordered the breakfast burrito & it was very tasty & a little spicy... Comes with hash browns or seasoned potatoes. Hash browns were way better... Also you get toast or coffee cake if you want it... Chocolate chips in the coffee cake. 

Eggs Benedict come in several varieties... We tried the vegetable type & it was good but would recommend clarification to the wait staff as to how you want it cooked. We found the eggs to be a bit undercooked. 

Also, if you don't want the English Muffin with the Benedict, you must ask them not to include it.  Vegetable means veggies on top of the English Muffin, topped with Spinach, Tomato & Avocado.

The Cracked Egg is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. The coffee cake is ALWAYS good and the scrambles are the best. All of the locations are small and intimate. The staff is always super friendly and happy to make suggestions if, like me, you can't make a decision on your own. They've never steered me wrong.

This was our first visit to The Cracked Egg.  We are not local, but travel to Las Vegas regularly.

ATMOSPHERE:  This is a casual and roomy restaurant.  They make the most of their space, but it definitely didn't feel cramped in any way.

SERVICE: Average.  Our server was friendly and offered her suggestions when asked.  She was very busy with many tables.  I was a little disappointed when she dropped off the bill without us asking for it, or asking if we were finished with our meal.  But when I needed a box to take my food to go, we had to flag her down.

FOOD:
The Enchilada -- Had just the right mixture of ingredients.  The sauce to pepper to tortilla to egg ratios complemented one another exquisitely without overpowering each other.  The hash browns were crispy (at our request) and tasty.  The coffee cake side was warm, sweet and delicious.

Croissant French Toast -- very tasty.  The bread was a little chewier than I'd hoped for but in retrospect, some croissants are chewy so I'm not sure this is avoidable.  The berries were absolutely delectable - fresh and full of flavor.

Overall, we were very satisfied with this experience and would return.
Great breakfast spot. The weather was perfect so asked to be sat in the patio area l. The food was good and service was fast.
Best breakfast joint in Summerlin! Reasonably priced and the menu is strong! Only downside, if there is one... place gets packed! But thats a GOOD sign, yeah?Ask for Victoria!

Great restaurant, friendly people and FAST service.  I was surprised to find so many items on the menu.  Came here for a late breakfast and it was busy but didn't have to wait anymore than 5 minutes.  I would return again.

This place gets only 1star as well because of the waitress was nice. One of the hostess as we walked in was rude and did not even smile. I commented for her to smile, the more she gave me this dagger look. We were excited about this new place but with what happened, it will be a while for the next visit.
Tried this place for breakfast today and it was great! Our waiter was friendly which we appreciated as good service is hard to come by these days! We will definitely be back when we are in town!

Delicious breakfast spot! We were in town for a soccer tournament and dropped by here for a late breakfast. 15 minute wait at 10:30 on. Friday morning was a good sign. Great service. Great food. One star off for the pancakes being a little too chewy instead of fluffy and melty like I think they should be. But 5 stars for the Sweet Potato skillet. Like the best version of breakfast raclette.

This is THE spot for breakfast in Vegas and I am a frequent flyer- you'll typically catch me here on a Saturday/Sunday once a week chowing down on a country benny.  I don't need a menu!  Seriously, you've gotta order their country benny.  The yolks are perfect and creamy (I'm salivating thinking of it now- it's almost pornographic!) thanks to a perfect cook every time!  The gravy has just the right amount of sausage, plus no paprika or green chiles or any other weird additions that you'll find in other breakfast joints.  The biscuits are always fluffy (once I had rock hard biscuits and they replaced them immediately) and I just love the rich combination of yolk, gravy, biscuit, and sausage.  I wish they were open 24/7, but I'm saving more money by only going in the mornings.

The coffee cake is fresh baked and always delicious.  I've never tried any of the cream cheese types, though (no thanks).  I've sampled some other things on the menu, but only when my boyfriend orders because I just cannot part from my one true love, the country benny.

I love you, Cracked Egg.  It's an unhealthy obsession, but the tongue and stomach wants what it wants.

My boyfriend and I came here because it was a nice stroll down from my house - the neighborhood feel was great - and it was sure busy!

We got seated immediately at a two top, although the weather was lovely enough to sit outside. The menu averages as a basic breakfast and lunch place with a traditional coffee cake offered as a side. 

My boyfriend ordered a classic eggs & bacon which is served with toast and potatoes and I was split between the Ole Benedict and chili skillet, choosing the latter. The food came out quick and hot within 5 minutes! 

Our waitress was decent if you include the business of the restaurant. Helpful and gave us attention when needed. Overall the food was great, enough cheese to satisfy the best fanatics. But nothing over the top in quality to make me a regular.

It's nice that it's close in the neighborhood as walking distance but I'll probably go back in a few months if I get a craving. 3/5

Service is always amazing but today was extra special.. We slept in and woke up starving we didn't realize that it was almost 2pm (closing) we didn't even make it to the restaurant door when we decided to go back to the truck.. The manager on duty (light blue shirt didn't catch her name) ran out and grabbed us and invited us in! Food was amazing!! Chocolate chip banana coffee cake was great today!! Thanks to the whole staff! :)
Rainy days = no lines! What a delicious way to spend my Sunday. The good was excellent and the service was amazing.  So many smiles as soon as you walk in the door. The enchilada omelet was great!!!

First time here and I must say, this place is good! Everything was made well and their cracked croissant was delicious! I will definitely visit this place again when I'm in Vegas again! It's similar to the broken yolk in Cali.
I ordered a custom veggie scramble and it was great. I requested fruit instead of potatoes and they provided colorful, fresh fruit. Pleasant service too!

Bland service. Bland food. Over priced breakfast. I was willing to look past all of that as I frequented this place three to four times a week since I live too close for it not to be practical. When I was turned away because u wanted to bring my 5lb dog into the patio on a Sunday morning and get service only to be rudely turned away, that was the last straw. I will never be a patron of this place again! Rachaels kitchen is down the street and they are dog friendly!

What you would expect from a country breakfast place l. Big portions and good quality. Usually long wait on the weekends but I guess that's not their fault people want to go there. If you're looking for a good breakfast in a chill environment this is your place but definitely not anything super special
You're normal breakfast fare, with free potatoes and break, i picked coffee bread. Warm, sweet and goes really well with coffee.

We are eating at the cracked egg the place is awesome friendly people awesome food  great place to take the family prices are great all around the best place to be in vegas  on 9921  west Charlestown blvd

My wife and I have been regulars here at least twice a week. The service and food, we have never had to complain.It also helps with their coupon. Today, after a great lunch, I tried to pay with their coupon and was told it is NOT accepted today due to the holiday. I asked what holiday and I was told Nevada Day. Yes, the coupon said no good on holidays, but I thought this was not a federal holiday, but a state holiday. I asked to speak with the manager, Juliana Yunis. With an attitude, she confirmed the above. No apology, just turned her back and walked away.  Do I dare walk in on All Saints Day?  As I said, the service and food is great, the manager needs to take a management course and at least smile. Left bad taste and will not return.

Rock solid and consistently good.  While not my favorite breakfast place in town, it's probably the one I go to the most because it's the perfect blend of convenience, tasty food and an always friendly staff.

Location.  Parking right at the restaurant can be difficult.  If you dont strike gold and find a spot in front of the restaurant, just park in the large lot that spans the front of the shopping center facing Charleston Blvd.  Getting into the parking lot is easy, but getting out can be tricky depending on where you're trying to go.  The Charleston - Hualapai intersection can be a challenge.

The Food.  As mentioned, the food is consistently good.  Over time I've tried all but one of the omelettes (the Carnitas is my favorite), three of the "scrambles" (try the Southshore Scramble for something mild, or the Southwest Scramble for a little zing), and three of the Eggs Benedict (the traditional Eggs Benedict is my favorite, with a side of bacon).  They also have amazing salads for a breakfast place.  I've never ventured into the pancakes, french toast or other similar breakfast items because I love eggs for breakfast enough that I never seem to stray away from them.  My wife and friends routinely get these other items though and have never been unhappy.

If you have a gluten sensitivity, there's a significant menu for you as well, so dive in!

The Staff.  In the end, the Cracked Egg is a large chain, and there are a number of similar breakfast chains out there.  I've been to a few.  (I might like breakfast.)  Big chain restaurants are..well, big chains and honestly it's hard for me to give them a rating higher than a three.  In fact, I usually don't review them unless they stand out for some reason.  In this case, the staff at this Cracked Egg location is what makes this a four star review.  So go, enjoy the food, and let the staff take care of you.
Love coming here the omelettes are so yummy!! I always get fruit on the side.. It's nice they have gealthy options on their menu
Great service and food. Portions are good, been there many times, never an issue.

I know this is going to sound crazy because this is a breakfast place but do your self a favor and ask what soup they have for the day and if it's the baked potato soup GET IT !!! I ordered the Mexican scramble (I think that's what it was Called ) it was good had Jalapnoes and chorizo and cheese tons of flavor and went great with the potatoes . My next tip is you get a choice of toast or the daily coffee cake which comes out warm and is a huge square that you could share if you felt so inclined ( I destroyed the whole thing ) this place was busy but they handle it well our food came out fast and it was all delicious . If your in the area stop in !

We came during a busy Sunday breakfast and even though the place was packed, the service was still great. My coffee cup was never empty and the biscuits and gravy I ordered were some of the best I've had. It was my first time dining there and I'll definitely go back.

Delicious food and fast service! 
My boyfriend and I ordered chicken fried steak with a coffee cake, and a Californian omelette. 
The coffee cake came out first and it was piping hot! It was a lemon cake and it was absolutely amazing. It tasted homemade and felt very nostalgic. The chicken fried steak was your standard affair. Delicious sausage gravy and yummy well seasoned potatoes. The Californian omelette had slices of bacon folded into the omelet, topped with a couple slices of cheese and a half of an avocado. 

It was very busy but the staff worked fast and efficiently that everything was still piping hot. It was our first time here and it's only up the street from our house. I don't know why we haven't gone her sooner.

This place is great. The options are incredible and they even have Gluten Free options! The wait can be a bit long so definitely choose your timing wisely or plan to add your name and shop at one of the nearby stores.
I just love this place! din in or dine out! the food is good fun and if your good you can find out about their secret hidden menu! (cordon blue bowl anyone!)

My family has been coming here for about two years probably about 2-4x's a month. Same location. It's always been pretty good breakfast and service but the last handful of visits the service has gotten worse. This last visit I walked in the front doors and wait behind a couple of people in line to put my name in for a table and some older whites guys walks up and bypasses the line to get a name if first. The only response I get from the hostess is "were you waiting to put a name in for a table?" In pretty sure I had a WTF look on my face. 

I only mention "older white guy" because I do see this white privilege entitlement around town. Mostly by "older white guys" and other middle aged white guys I would assume is the off spring of the older ones. Many times I confront them about cutting in line for things and they just throw their hands up like "I don't know." 

So in short, my family will frequent cracked eggs a lot less.

Yummy coffee cake, ok food that lacks flavor development. HORRIBLY SLOW SERVICE. Oh and their fresh squeezed orange juice....isn't. Servers are aloof.  Won't be back. The Ann Rd location kills this one. The highlight was a really nice, polite and helpful busboy.

Just finished a delightful breakfast.  I would definitely go back but still doesn't beat my favorite place... Blueberry hill pancake house.  Love the new location of this place. Fast and pleasant service. Never had to wait or ask for a refill on our water and coffee. Coffee cake is a great choice. Moist warm and not overly sweet with the right amount of icing.  I've had the monte crisco at the different location which I do love but this time had the egg white scramble. Nice flavor and a good serving size.  Will be back.

This place has great food and really nice servers, BUT it is a struggle to order vegetarian dishes.

We wanted to substitute veggies for meat on an omelet, but were told no because their policy is meat for meat substitute only.

This is the first restaurant that hasn't accommodated vegetarian needs. I would have given a higher rating had it been different. We won't be coming back because we can't eat here.

This place has the best coffee cakes ever! Always friendly service, and very fast and attentive! Staff always has great attitude considering they have to be there early hours and have to deal with all the grumpy old farts that come in they still hold it all together!

The Cracked Egg is very similar to other popular "egg" breakfast joints but I don't believe they're under the same ownership. The restaurant is in a space that used to house a hipster slider joint so there are still remnants of a once trendy space. 

The service and menu is pretty standard for this type of place. I would recommend trying the croissant French toast if you're not in the mood for eggs. Eggs are the star here. The coffee is not. It's so weak that it tastes like hot water with an almost indistinguishable hint of coffee.

Had the cinnamon pancakes and they were very good.  Loved every bite. The coffee was just okay. Order something a little darker. The potatoes were cooked crispy the way I like them. Bacon was good quality. A good spot for breakfast!

This is a decent place for breakfast.  It has all that you want in the typical American breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, you name it.  It's fine.  The portion sizes are decent, and the price is what you'd expect.  Nothing really stands out as amazing, but nothing to sneeze at.  The decor at the entrance of the restaurant is cool, somewhat vintage, which I like, including a sign that "Unaccompanied children will be given an espresso and a new puppy."  

The location is what makes this a great option.  It is on the corner of Charleston and Hualapai in Summerlin, a prime spot if you're on your way to Red Rock or live in the area.  Not that many free-standing breakfast joints around.

I was driving around looking for a breakfast spot and found The Cracked Egg on Yelp.  All sounded great so I stopped by.  

The restaurant was very clean and the hostess very welcoming.  I ordered the Big Bad Wolf Omelette and of course after reading the Yelp reviews the coffee cake.  

The Omelette was huge!!  Cooked to perfection and the meat within so delicious!  The coffee cake was amazing to the palette!  No wonder so many mention it on Yelp!  I can't believe this place isn't just 5 Star rating all around just for the coffee cake!   

The Cracked Egg will definitely be one of my first stops on my next visit to Vegas!

Food is fresh fresh fresh!!!
Taste lean and clean . The restaurant has a nice ambience. This was my second visit and even more satisfied

We discovered The Cracked Egg two years ago on a prior visit to Vegas.  After a great experience we added it to the itinerary for this trip.  Aside from the Home Goods-Happy decorating choices, everything about this place is great.  Food portions are huge, quality is spot on and bellies were full!  We had a server named Amanda from San Diego and she was truly just a joyful human.  Always smiling, accommodating and helpful.  The best service we have had out this entire week in Vegas.  If you read my reviews, I'm not easily impressed but credit where its due...here's to Amanda, great food and great service!

I wanted to try this since it reminded me of a couple other "Breakfasty style places" here in Las Vegas, but this is super close to home.

I have had two great meals here! And look forward to more!

Once was on a weekday, it was delightfully quiet, had great service and the food came out really quickly! Not a single complaint!!

The next time was on a Sunday, definitely not quiet..Because clearly the food is good! Not a problem, put our name on the list, sauntered over to StarBucks in Smiths (10 steps away), and headed back. With in minutes we were seated!
The Cracked Egg does not crack when they are slammed! That is a good sign!
OK, maybe the young male host looked a little shell shocked, but I assume he is new? But worry not, the seasoned girls kept it ALL together! Like a well oiled breakfast machine! A coffee station upfront while you are waiting could be a nice touch, but now I am just being nit-picky. I would happily go back anytime!

Over all, rock solid 4 star food! Great service! And an easy price point.
What is not to love about all of that?

Good gravy!  Good God!  You get a TON of food.  I am still full and i ate there in December.  The omelette I ordered had a TON of avocados on it.  Usually they put like 3 and call it a California Omlette.  But no.  They put like 7 slices.  And did I mention the gravy and biscuits?  Off the strip, waaaay off the strip.  Thats how to appreciate Vegas.

The corn beef hash was just so so. The corn beef was not "hashed".Waitress should have warned me not to order the hash brown because there is already potatoes under the corn beef.  Should have sub it with fruits.

This breakfast place  is exactly what this area needs. Flooded with natural light,  cheerful and airy. Waiting stuff was friendly.

Next time I'll just order eggs over easy, toast and coffee. Other stuff on the menu looks too heavy.
I'm a lover of Corned Beef Hash & Eggs so I thought I would try it. Far from the best and I think they skimp on portion for what they charge. Service and coffee was Great

Came here for brunch on a Friday morning and my party of 2 was seated right away. Service was generally pretty quick even though the place seemed packed. I got the chile verde rancheros and at first sight it didn't look like much. It just looked like a big blob of food haha but every bite was delicious. Kind of tastes like a chimichanga lol overall, a great place for breakfast/brunch. They have a huge variety of food to choose from and the staff is really friendly.

I have been here for breakfast a few times and it is average at best. Small and somewhat bland portions with ok service.  Looking around for another local cafe as I am relatively new to the area. Anyone have any suggestions??
Love everything about this place. So welcoming. Food is great. This is my go to breakfast spot.
Stopped in with my parents for lunch had the North Shore Scramble, it's was better than I expected. Our service was good overall I would recommend stoping by if your ever in the area.

Got to start off by saying that their mocha coffee cake was to die for and its been the only thing on my mind these past few days. It comes to your table with legit steam still, super hot, moist & delicious. I ordered a Denver omelette and it was great. I do have to say that Egg works Denver omelette was just the slightest bit better BUT.. The coffee cake and delicious potatoes at cracked egg will definitely be the reason I come back!

We came to the cracked egg after a morning run. We chose them because of the good reviews and they were open before 8:00. We were not disappointed. They have a gluten sensitive menu that we ordered a blueberry muffin. That and both of our omelets were very good. They do have a kids menu but our little guy just ate off our plates. All in all very good!

The Cracked Egg you have done it! Won my future business! I've been trying to find a couple more breakfast places to go to on a regular basis and it's been super difficult! I seem to live by tons of these breakfast places however the past few that I've been to have been hard to beat my all time favorite Pancake House! 

This past Sunday as always I treated my mother to Sunday Brunch and told her that we would try a different place. The Cracked Egg was chosen based on the other errands that had to be ran in that area of town. When we pulled up I just knew the wait was going to be ridiculous based on the amount of cars that were parked outside, boy was I wrong! As I sat patiently waiting I couldn't help but notice all these cute little pictures and signs that had some interesting quotes on them. Less than a 10 minute wait we were seated and provided our menus! Customer service here is very good! Every staff member was smiling and greeting us and the whole vibe just seemed to be pleasant. 

The variety of items on the menu is pretty good! There are tons of things I wanted to try but because an omelet was what my taste buds were screaming about I decided on "The Big Bad Wolf" Mom ordered "The Garden Patch". Who doesn't love cool names for the items they order? Some probably find it cheesy (no pun intended) but I love the creativeness! You get an option of potatoes, toast and coffee cake with any of the omelet's. Since I was already drooling over the previous YELPER's pics of the coffee cake I went with that of course! Something cool that they do is change the flavor of them every so often. Mine just happened to be apple! Yum! When our food arrived everything looked and tasted great! I had to give them a couple extra brownie points for nailing my request for egg whites on the omelet! Majority places NEVER get it correct and I always have to end up sending it back. Can't be trying to kill me with all that cholesterol! 

Check out was great! Our cashier was friendly just like everyone else we encountered that morning! Asked how our dining experience was and even welcomed us back as soon as possible! I noticed as I was paying for our breakfast that they have a rewards program and when I fill this form out I could get $8 off the next breakfast! I can't wait to return! Awesome job guys!

5 visits and it's always been great! The servers have all been friendly, helpful and cheerful. The food has been great and I've been getting from different parts of the menu each time. The only thing to keep in mind is you may have to wait 20-30 minutes during the busy hours, that's not incoming but keep it in mind (I've overheard others complaining about it while we've been waiting)

We come here almost once a week and we'll continue to do so !

This place never fails to impress.  The food is consistently delicious and the staff is wonderful.  More impressive, the quality carries from location to location.

I've tried a lot on the menu and yet to be disappointed, even lunch is good.  Mainly I come for breakfast though.  Scrambles, omelets and benny's... oh my!  I think the southwest scramble is my personal favorite.  Spicy and yummy just like me.  If spicy isn't your thing, try the south shore scramble.  Chicken and avocado will set you up for a good day.

Very nice servers. The food was very good the first visit. Second visit we had a party of 6, nothing was fresh. Food was coming out in spurts, we had to wait 15 minutes for one dish while they served a dish before that to one of our other guests. They were all over the place. I will give them another chance as they were busy but there isn't any excuse for this type of service.

Great place for breakfast!   I had one of the breakfast skillets and everything in it was perfect.  Everything I saw looked incredible.  I will definitely come back here a lot more.  It looks like the best place in town to get breakfast.  The lunch menu didn't look too bad either!  The few downsides of it, is I went on a Sunday at 11am and there was about a 30 minute wait for a table.  I don't know why they have such a small location for the business that they do?!   The service is a tad on the slow side, but they do get the orders right, so that's not a big deal.  However, if you are in a hurry, this is not the place for you.  It is in a busy shopping center to begin with, so the parking can be a bit of a challenge.  And it is very loud in there, so it you're looking for a nice quiet brunch place, this also isn't the place for you.   But if you don't mind these issues, the food is definitely worth it!

One of our favorite breakfast spots to go to. We go to this location the most. Gets crowded at times but it's pretty spacious compared to other cafes. They have plenty of seating inside and outside. Depending on the time you go , we usually go on Sunday's , a little later in the am and have never had to wait no more longer than 10-15 minutes for a table. For as early as they have to be up, staff is always friendly and welcoming. We've had Andi and Steve several times as our server and do an excellent job but from what I remember all servers are awesome. They are very attentive and genuine. My favorite dish is the cordon bleu skillet. If you're like me and love to eat sometimes thats just not enough. I get the banana chocolate chip pancakes as well and can get just one or a two stack instead the 3 but you have to request for it I believe. Just check the menu. They are really great about meeting your requests on substitutions too! Highly recommended to try.
This place gets two stars because the service was good. Our waitress was accommodating. But the food wasn't that great. The food feels like something frozen and got microwaved.
Food was great and came out super fast. The entire staff was friendly. I will come back
Since I moved to Vegas 3 years ago This place has always had great service and food. They are quick, efficient and very friendly. I recommend this place to everybody!
Bestest breakfast spot in Vegas! Their coffee cake is amazing and the service is always great

Disappointing at best! Overall, my breakfast had little flavor (SW Scramble). I love jalapenos, but this dish is way too overloaded and it didn't appear to add flavor. The chorizo was sour and my guess is there was 1 egg and about 4 cups of cheese. Potatoes appear to be out of a bag from the freezer and in turn were extremely dry. I even tried drenching them with salsa. Still not good. After a few bites I pushed my plate away. Waitress came by and asked how everything was. I said "terrible". Her response (obviously wasn't really listening)....ok great, enjoy! I had to ask for coffee refills each time. And keep in mind that we were sitting at the bar. When we left, the cashier asked how our meals were. My boyfriend told him....mine was just OK but my girlfriend was only able eat a few bites of hers. His response....glad to hear it. Disappointing meal and clueless staff. We definitely won't be back. Lots of other options in Vegas.

This place is the reason why I finally opened a Yelp account... 
I wanted to take my boyfriend to breakfast for his birthday so I looked up some places since we are from out of town, and I decided to come here. The menu had a bunch of delicious options from peanut butter French toast to croissant egg sandwich. The variety of egg Benedicts caught my eye so I decided on the Veggie one with avocado, spinach and grilled tomatoes and my boyfriend chose the Pastrami Benedict and an order of chocolate chip pancakes. 
My order was a beautiful display and tasted even better than it looked. I enjoyed every single bite! My boyfriend loved his dish as well and we could barely get into the pancakes since we were quite full with our benedict plates. Price was reasonable for the amount of food and service was great, very friendly waitress and bright, welcoming, cute decorative setting. 
After leaving I believe I said out loud "that was the best breakfast I've had in a long time" about 5 times! I will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas and recommend it to many others. 
Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Awesome Breakfast!!! I had the Western Scramble.  We also had the Eggs Benedict and Huevos Rancheros -
All was GREAT!!! 
The warm Coffee Cake is to Die for - A must try !!!!

Worse breakfast we've had  out.  Scrabble eggs...nothing great.  Ordered a croissant..waitress offered to heat it...the cook split it in half and grilled it in some disgusting grease.  Ctoisssnt sre dupposed to be light n flaky.  The jam is prepackaged heinz sugary cheap stuff.  The hot chocolate was made w package mix and water. ..very watery so waitress gave me another packet to mix myself.  Coffee was like water.  If uou have a breakfast place...better have great coffee.  Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but if you can't get a basic simple breakfast right. ..we wouldn't try for more.

Had a great working breakfast at the cracked egg. Very complete menu, but was surprised at how well it was prepared and fresh ingredients. I had an Eggs Benedict, it was to perfection. The rest of the food on the table looked magnificent, and the service was very friendly. Would recommend they improve their coffee however in this day and age. Otherwise a fantastic experience overall.

Was here on Sunday. Waitress was fantastic. However we had ants all over our table & had to move. In addition the main reason we went there was to use the $8.00 credit that was on the rewards card I registered for.  However the manager informed me at check out that the credit would have to be used at a different time once the rewards company had mailed it out. Not only that but she was all but rude in how she explained it and was not even apologetic for the ant situation. You would think that under the circumstances she would have at the minimum offered to buy our drinks or something. So very disappointed with how this was handled.

We have eaten here many times and the food is great, today was also great!
Unfortunately the hostess today was absolutely the crabbiest!!!
When we arrived she was on the phone, which appeared to be a personal call. It took her a few minutes to complete her call, never making eye contact with us. When we asked to be seated outside she opened the door and just pointed to a table. She did not smile at all plus made us feel as though we were a huge inconvenience to her.
When paying for our meal she never asked if everything was ok, never smiled, just in general very rude.
This type of behavior for the employees at this restaurant is very unusual as they are always very nice at the Charleston location. Not sure if we will return!
We visited on 4/11/2018, paid our bill at 8:45am.

Love this place! It's our go-to breakfast place in summerlin. The service is always excellent, quick and friendly. The food is fresh and delicious every time. It's reasonably priced. Can't say enough good things about the Cracked Egg!

Went for the first time yesterday after working out. The service was great. The menu has plenty of choices. My wife ordered a skillet which was great. I ordered the Chili Verde Rancheros and the regular hash browns. I am glad they serve regular hash browns.

The coffee cake was tasty however, have you ever microwaved coffee cake and it is really hot in the center plus has a feel that screams microwaved? It was kind of like that. I would rather have a piece of warm coffee cake that did not pass through a microwave(just seems like it did).

My meal was very tasty but the shredded pork in the Rancheros had hard edges like it had been sitting out.

Lastly, when we walked in and asked for a booth, the hostess gave us a gas face as if by asking for a booth we were throwing off the table rotation by not taking a two top.

But...we will be back. If I did not like the place it would get less then 4 stars

Not sure what the high demand is about. Food wasn't bad but wasn't that good. We had great service from the front desk and waitress. Very efficient considering how busy they are. Nothing special. Wont be back. I ordered the enchilada omelette and my fiance ordered the Greek omelette. He agrees this place is OVER RATED. But again the atmosphere is upbeat and friendly.

We have been here a couple of times. Every time has been great. One of our favorite breakfast spots in Vegas. They always get you seated fast even on weekends. The omelets are huge and filling. They have different types of coffee cake depending on the day, raspberry has been my favorite so far. They also have a great menu for people with gluten allergy which is nice.

Best breakfast I've had in a long time!!  My husband and I met a friend here over the holidays while we were in Vegas and talked about the place to everyone the rest of the trip!  They do a great job but get there early so you don't have a long wait!

To start off, some of the complaints people have about this place are ridiculous. One person complained they don't have wifi. Is your company or ADHD really that bad that you can't hold a conversation with them? Is multi tasking really that much more important than sitting back and relaxing for 45 mins? What could you possibly be doing that's so important that you really need wifi for anyway? And no. If I'm there trying to enjoy a meal on the patio, I don't want someone's dog there, regardless of breed or size. Unless it's a service dog, why would you expect to bring it everywhere like an accessory? I'm sure they would rather lose the one customer that was butthurt they couldn't bring their animal to breakfast instead of losing three or four customers that would want a dog there. As for the service complaints, there are no complaints from me. I came for a quick breakfast with my mom. Everything came out fast and hot. We were asked if we had everything we need and if we needed anything else, let her know. Then we were left alone to eat and have a conversation without the server coming by every few minutes interrupting us asking if we needed anything. If I we did need anything, we would have gotten her attention and communicated with her instead of rearranging some dishes on the table and hope that she could read our minds that we needed something specific. 
My mom got a veggie skillet which looked good, but not my type of thing. Plus I was craving their chocolate chip banana pancakes which definitely hit the spot. I also had scrambled eggs and sausage patties which you can't really mess up. If you think the food is bland, there is not much to do about that. It's all about personal preference and restaurants can't please everyone. They aim to please as many as they can, usually. Other places do what they do regardless of people's opinions. But that's usually certain types of food. Overall I've never had a bad experience here, and I would definitely go back. As for the price, meh, not too cheap or expensive. If you say you'd rather go to Mcd's then so be it. That's another case of opinion. Maybe you prefer that peculiar Mcd's flavor that's in all of their products. I'm not sure what that is, but I'm sure you know what I'm talking about.
Great place to eat...fast service...excellent food.

Tried this place for the first time and loved it! Our new breakfast place! Talk about a delicious coffee cake! Sinful! My favorite is The Californian omelet ... And service is quick! You definitely don't sit hungry for long! The wait staff is friendly and overall a great environment!

We stayed at red rock and wanted a quick breakfast before heading out. And found this place little over a mile away from the resort.

We got there around 8 on a Sunday morning. There was no wait. We got seated right away.

The service was great! There are a ton of menu selections yo choose from.

We got the corned beef hash, north shore scramble and the kids got chocolate chip pancakes. 

I personally didn't like the corned beef. The corned beef was just ok. I got it with their popular coffee cake and seasoned potatoes.

The north shore scramble was ok, if you like onions then this is the one for you. We don't like onions THAT much so we didn't care for it. 

The kids liked their chocolate chip pancakes. It tasted like any other chocolate chip pancake. Nothing special. It was just the pancakes, no fruit or meat option unless you order a side order. 

Would we go back...probably not. 



The coffee cake was light and arrived warm to the table. If I could sum up that coffee cake, it seemed like an angel cake with something (like an apple compote or jam) on the bottom and topped with an icing glaze.
Great location...place is new and is nice. The service needs improvement. We waited. About 20 mins before anyone took our order...food is great on the other hand

This place is to breakfast as Wonder Woman is to star spangled knickers. The pesto scramble was ridiculously delicious. I descended on it in an egg frenzy, like a yolk smeared Cookie Monster who just finished an hour of cardio. The waitress was this chirpy, smiling maelstrom of efficient food delivery and coffee pourage. She even laughed at one of my jokes. Try this place. Just try it. You'll look back on that breakfast as the day dwindles and the golden honey light soaks your living room and think "Yes. That was good."

After my doctor's appointment this morning, I stopped here for breakfast.  The place opened recently and I wanted to check it out knowing that it was part of a chain.

Before looking at the menu, one of the bus people came and brought me coffee. I first checked the specials board.  Then I looked over the menu.  After some thought, I went with one of the specials and ordered a Cordon bleu skillet.  The skillet had potatoes, chicken, ham, and swiss cheese and Hollandaise.  I got my two eggs over easy and rye toast.

In less than five minutes, my server brought the skillet over and it looked great!  It also tasted that way.  The chicken pieces were real chicken--not formed chicken.  The swiss cheese covered the top.  I was pleasantly surprised that the skillet was not heavy on cubed potatoes to use a cheaper ingredient to cut back on the ham and chicken.

My coffee was refilled without waiting and service was good.  I'm glad we now have a good breakfast place in the neighborhood.
The montecristo is the best and for a decent price. Would definitely recommend to family and friends.
I had the carnitas omelet here the other day.  It really was more of a green chili omelet.  Nothing special; a decent place for a breakfast meal.

breakfast is my favorite meal! cracked egg is always so busy, and yet, they find you seats very quickly and the servers are always so joyful and give you quality time. they don't act rushed bit make you feel special and welcome. sweet potato skillet with bacon and apples was bomb!

One of my favorite go to breakfast places. Service has always been good although there is always a wait here because it can get really busy but totally worth the wait. I either order a GVP omelette or the cracked croissant so good! Tried many other things and have yet to complain.

Today on 1/15/16 I had an urge both for blueberry pancakes and to change up things from the Grand Cafe experience at Red Rock. Based on Yelp research I chose The Cracked Egg because it has generated some good reviews and was very close to my hotel. My server, Tabitha greeted me with a smile and, very considerately, steered me to a larger table in the nearly empty restaurant. at 6:45 a.m., instead of compelling me to sit at a smaller table as many other places do. She provided the restaurant's extensive menu promptly and simultaneously took my order for coffee. The coffee was good and she diligently re-filled my cup until I cried uncle.I ordered two Blueberry Pancakes after she patiently explained that I had the option of ordering one, two or three, which the menu did not make evident.

The pancakes, unfortunately, tasted dry and leaden.They were not fluffy and light. They were hard to eat.They could not stand up to the excellent blueberry pancakes that I have had at Blueberry Hill restaurants during prior trips to Vegas. Perhaps the recipe can be tweaked because this is a family, and not a corporate, restaurant?

Prior to my leaving, Tabitha let me know where I could find some much needed cold medicine.It is the combination of her excellent service, the fact that my food experience diverged so much from the majority and the likelihood that I did not order the correct item that explains my decision to award an extra star.These factors would induce me to try The Cracked Egg again if I stay at Red Rock in the future.

Love this place! Our favorite local breakfast spot and we were so happy when they opened this location in Summerlin. We are always greeted warmly and seated quickly. The service is fast and efficient and the food comes out quickly. Always order the coffee cake instead of toast! It's delicious and so light and moist and served warm. 

I like the build your own breakfast skillet with the seasoned potatoes! I also like that they have vanilla creamers for my coffee :) 

Always a great experience and the food is always amazing. In my opinion, it's a little on the pricy side for breakfast but everything is now a days.

Stopped at this place on the way to hike Red Rock Canyon. It is a small place in a corner of a shopping mall. But the staff was super friendly and the breakfast I had was GREAT!  I would come back again and again. If you come this way, stop in and pick your favorite from their menu. 

p.s. the lady next table ordered soup and it looked wonderful.
Great breakfast place! It's a cute little diner style place and their breakfast is wonderful. They care about how you want your food! The service was great too.I'll definitely be back.

I have been here twice and so far I have had a great experience.  Food is great especially the pumpkin coffee cake.  I brought my kids and they loved it.  It's not everywhere that you will find pb&j on the menu. Customer service was awesome as well.  There was one mistake but she fixed it really fast and with a smile....
