Thank you everything about this cracked egg was awesome

It was really difficult for me to choose what I wanted from the menu, everything sounded so good! 

I really enjoyed what I decided on, the croissant french toast. They didn't skimp out on the berries like most places do- they totally loaded it up! The coffee cake is also to die for. 

My family (whom I went with) also all enjoyed their meals. Also, great service and very friendly staff.
Best breakfast place ever. Good service. I'd eat here every morning if I could. I like that they have an outdoor patio. And I love their breakfast skillets and lunches too!

TRUE breakfast lovers be advised: very ordinary food. Great atmosphere, very warm and attentive staff, and an extensive menu of skillets, omelettes, griddle dishes and benedicts. But sadly the food just doesn't carry. Sorry Cracked Egg, I'll be back, but with lowered expectations for food quality. A typical 3 star experience

First time here, last stop before heading to the airport and I am MORE than content, the food was amazing! Honestly the best breakfast skillet I've ever had. I asked the server for a recommendation and she recommended exactly what I was debating on! I had the Country fried steak skillet and the coffee came it came with was also super delicious and freshly made, definitely definitely recommend this place to anyone passing through, arriving, leaving or even lives here but hasn't tried it lol I had Tabitha as my server and she made the experience that much better, will be back very soon!!

simple, casual breakfast joint near red rocks.

hearty portions. no frills. delicious.

glad i went there for breakfast rather than somewhere on the strip.

Went this a.m. For breakfast . We were seated immediately .the 1 st thing you notice is that the room has a high open ceiling . It was very noisy . Our waitress was very sweet and immediately brought us coffee. And offered us a nice warm strawberry coffee cake very yummy  I had an omelette of spinach mushrooms & Munster cheese it was very good. Although a lot of melted cheese. Which our waitress noticed I was scrapping off. And asked if I would like another one without . I said it was fine just the way it was ! Coffee kept coming . My companion had the chili skillet and he enjoyed it . All in all good food and service.

Love the "Taylor's Scramble"!! Used to live in Henderson and would go almost every week and would always get the same thing. Now every time I'm in town, I have to go to Cracked Egg to get my scrambled egg + cream cheese fix! So happy they have so many locations now. The coffee cake always changes and am always curious to try it since the Taylor's Scramble comes with coffee cake or toast!
Very good breakfasts are served here. Eggs are cooked to perfection. I especially like the home cooked corned beef hash. People are friendly. But service is somewhat slow.

Here we are all the way from the sands of Santa Cruz...Viva Las Vegas.
The Cracked Egg
I ordered the Southwest Scramble. mmmmm
Meh!
Burried in cheese with huge slices of jalapenos  onions and....I think its ground beef ...really not sure.
Blandwest scramble. Had to try to remove the layer of artirial clogging cheese goo . More ketchup and salt no help. The is the whitest scramble Ive ever happened upon. Theres a missed opportunity here in the dusty Southwest. All I can find is dissapointment on a plate. Dont you worry one hoot though, Ill give you another chance.

I don't know if it is because I'm here hungry or what, but this place is delicious. A cute, unassuming spot that serves a stress free breakfast delight. I hope you are lucky enough to get Amanda. Note: Green Scramble

Best effing breakfast in town! The chili cheese skillet is ev-ry-thing! Relatively inexpensive! The best hostesses and waiters/waitresses around. Tends to be on the busy side on weekends, the brunch crowd can get a little hectic, so expect at least a 30 min wait, but it's well worth the wait.

If you are from out of town and need a tasty brunch place on the way to Red Rocks (or anywhere east of the strip) THIS IS YOUR SPOT! Easy to access from the main road, and only about 5-10 minutes from Red Rocks visitor center. Much more affordable than most breakfast places on the strip, and definitely a place for locals. Friendly service, tasty standard breakfast dishes (with veggie options) and BOMB coffee cake!

My boyfriend and I have gone here two times for Sunday breakfast and both times have loved our meal and our experience so much. I've ordered the country fried steak and gravy, no eggs, and with potatoes both times I've been and it's been amazingly delicious each time. I also ordered coffee cake both times and both flavors were not a disappointment at all. My boyfriend ordered the croissant sandwich and the Mexican skillet and enjoyed both, but wants the country fried steak and gravy next time we go. I definitely recommend it!

The prices are reasonable for the food you order and the portion sizes are decent. I've never left the restaurant still hungry or too full. We've had no problems as far as service goes with our waitresses being super friendly. There are lots of servers and staff walking around to check on tables and maintain a clean dining room. Both the indoor and the outdoor seating areas are nice to sit in. I recommend the outdoor seating only early in the morning when it's not too hot (this is Las Vegas after all). Also, just a side note, this place does get relatively busy in the morning for breakfast and brunch, so prepare for a short wait, even for the outdoor seating area usually. I expect there is about a 30-45 minute wait during peak hours, so around 10-11:30am.

The staff was exceptional,  very prompt with service,  and sitting us. The menu was delightful with all the different ways to have your eggs plus other items as well.  I will def try the churro french toast next time i come in.
What a gem! We were visiting Las Vegas and staying off the strip, and I'm so glad our hotel valet recommended this place. Good food, great service, and cozy atmosphere - a definite 5 star experience!

stop what you're doing and go to the Cracked egg and try the Kickin Grilled Cheese! 
frikken amazing! 
I usually always go for breakfast but this time went for lunch and was NOT dissapointed. 
Soooo bomb!!!! 
Ashley was our server. Attentive, friendly and a great attitude! Thank you to everyone at the Cracked Egg!!! 
you guys are all awesome!!!

I have been meaning to try this place for a while. Today I got that chance and this was so mediocre and blah I would have been better off going to McDonald's for a better value and not have to tip a waitress who reminded me of a robot. First off there was enough salt in this food to start my own Salton sea. My measure of how the rest of food is at a new restaurant is the Eggs Benedict so I always try that first...big pet peeve alert....why do restaurants insist on serving crappy powder mix hollandaise ..IT SUCKS.....is it so hard to put in some extra effort to make homemade sauce?..the seasoned potatoes tasted like they were put on a conveyor belt of salt and run thru like 20 times...i paid 2.45 for coffee..and 3.75 for an oj...total rip off..im tired of mediocre crap being pawned off on the public in order to keep the owners of these places from losing money. the waitress was going thru the motions dropped my check before i was even finished,did not ask if i wanted a warm up on my coffee nor a to go cup for my Starbucks costing java...The verdict is more crap service and food for 21 dollars..at least McDonald's is consistent....after i ate this garbage i had to find a bathroom quickly as I got an instant irritable bowel reaction...such a pleasant way to start the day....me thinks not!!

The food was okay, I got the corn beef hash, the corn beef was a bit dry and so were the seasoned potatoes, but my eggs were perfect. The service was alright, I just wish the waitress was more talkative. Overall it's an alright restaurant.

There are many menu items I favor.  The chile relleno omelet is my typical choice.  I order a side of avocado to make it "perfect" for me.  Staff is always courteous and attentive.  Atmosphere is active.  Decor is nice.  Sometimes there is a wait for seating but we've never had to wait more than about 15 minutes at most.  Food is consistently delicious.  This is a great family restaurant as they are ready, willing and able to accommodate with high chairs and roomy seating options.  Sometimes I find coupons and I think there is an app for 'rewards'.  If you sign in with Yelp you get a complimentary muffin!

Food was ok. Service was terrible. Never came back after dropping off food. Never offered a refill on coffee or soda then when after 40 minutes came back with bill told us she was busy.  And walked away. Walked past our table next to the entry to food prep area at least 20 times. Never be back. Would not recommend.

Went there this morning, post piano recital, so probably about 10:30. On a Saturday morning, you expect a wait at that hour. We waited, but briefly, and everyone was very nice. The food was delicious (especially the seasoned potatoes....flavorful and perfectly cooked! Not greasy or bland or overdone like at so many places!) and reasonably priced. We'll definitely be back!

Service was good, food was good.
I have to say price wise it was a bit much but overall good experience.

Was not impressed.  My coconut/macadamia pancakes were dry as a bone.  Literally.  They need to add whipped cream or something.  I also got their sweet potato fries...which were THE WORST i've ever eaten (dry, small portion, and almost inedible).  And how much were these sweet potato fries?  Seriously like 5 bucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My hubby got their eggs benedict platter, and he was also unimpressed.  So $40 later, you're left feeling ripped off and still hungry.  OH MY.
Joes scramble with cream cheese is divine. Outstanding first class service. Wouldn't believe I was in a breakfast/lunch place. Really good quality to boot!

Not a fan :( the food was average and the atmosphere and the staff didn't help much. The place felt like it was just a big efficiency machine instead of a nice intimate place to have a good breakfast with friends. I survived the breakfast but will not go back. I'm sure there are other places more to my taste...
Good fast service.  Good food while you're here.  Place was clean without crumbs on the floor.  Highly recommended.

Great experience, food and service. Overall a really good vibe from the restaurant. The hostess seated us quickly and was polite. The waitress attended us right away as well and always checked if we needed anything else. When the food arrived everything looked and smelled delicious. I ordered the 2 cakes, 2 pieces of bacon and eggs along with a has brown and literally stuffed my face! Can't wait to go back again!

Exactly what I was looking for in a breakfast place. I was looking to get away from the IHOP's and Denny's. This place exceeded my expectations. I ordered the Bacon Omelette with a side of seasoned potatoes. I think I'll be coming back just the seasoned potatoes! The food was delicious and came hot. Not like it was sitting under a warmer. The service was great! Definitely will be coming back!
There were many wonderful gluten free options! Gluten free pancakes, and muffins and toast, and egg dishes were on the gf menu.

First time here with a friend of mine. He had recommend it to me. First off.. The coffee cake! Oh god it is a must have here. Its so fresh, warm, and full of flavor! I ordered the Monte Cristo. It French Toast stuffed with turkey ham and cheese. Let me tell you what a wonderful and delicious combo this makes. We also shared the Coconut Macadamia Pancakes. Those pancakes give this establishment five stars alone. The service was good I didn't get the young gals name. If I'm ever by this side of town I'll definitely stop by again!
Great place for breakfast. Food was excellent and cute atmosphere with creative signs
great breakfast. you cant screw up eggs but you can pancakes and they were great. fast and easy.
Solid breakfast spot on the weekends. Highly recommend the eggs benedict with seasoned potatoes and coffee! Service is quick and great.

This place was located close to the resort we were staying at so why not give it a try?  My husband ordered the egg and cake combo and I got the Big Bad Wolf omelette.  The heading on the omelette section of the menu touted "Fluffy & Folded".  When my omelette arrived, there was a layer of oozing cheese on top that I had to scrape off...AND it was flat and not one bit fluffy.  I am used to omelettes where the ingredients are encased in fluffy eggs.  This one looked liked a scramble that was flattened and folded over.  Look at my picture and you can be the judge.  My husband liked his banana pancakes but I could barely finish my order.  IMO, there is nothing special about the breakfasts here.  We will not be coming back.
Food was deelish, staff was pleasant and atmosphere was casual. We will definitely be back for more

First time at this location...1pm on a Tuesday. The food was good we got huevos rancheros and corned beef hash..but the service was ridiculously s l o w. It took 20 minutes after finishing the meal before the check was dropped :( good food though.

I had my assistant call the Cracked Egg to ask for an owner I could send the below letter to. "Curtis" got on the phone, wouldn't give his last name, and yelled at my assistant! So with no other outlet than Yelp, here's the letter:

To Whom It May Concern:

I live very near the new Cracked Egg restaurant at Charleston and Hualapai. My inquisitive 3-year-old daughter watched with great anticipation as the new "muffin store" was being built, and the morning of 4/27/14 I took her there (she was very excited). I would normally bring my wife and 1-year-old son, but my wife was home sick with a cold.

What followed was the worst customer service experience of my life. Given the recent opening of the restaurant, wait staff and hostesses were understandably unpracticed and the operation wasn't running as smoothly as I expect it will over time. However, when I complained to the manager about needlessly waiting for 15 minutes after it was our turn to be seated, a man approached me, and with no introduction or conversation, promptly escorted me out the front door (my 3-year-old daughter riding on my hip), and rudely and loudly told me to "get in my car, leave, and never come back." I encouraged him to listen to me, his customer, and he rudely told me "look around, are you the only one here with an infant?" 

I'm not a loud, large, or scary-looking man; in fact, I'm a 47-year-old, well-respected member of the business community. I serve on two high profile community boards, and own and operate a small, local business. Suffice it to say, I've never been banned from any establishment, and found the whole experience horrifying, especially in light of having my young daughter with me.

The saddest part of this experience is my 3-year-old daughter now speaks (unsolicited) about the "bad man at the Cracked Egg who wouldn't let us have pancakes and bacon." She shouldn't have to worry about facing hostility at any of our neighborhood establishments. It's shameful.

Sincerely,
Jeff G.

I've been missing out.  Apparently The Cracked Egg is not affiliated with Egg Works or Egg & I (the usual breakfast spots I frequent).  So the original plan was to go to the new Egg Works in Summerlin, but my friend actually drove us to this joint which also recently opened.  

Saturday brunch - 25 min wait.  Well, let me take this time to walk over to Smiths and buy cookies and Cheez its.  At least there was something to do during the wait.

I give the food 5 stars.  All the dishes were super good.  We ordered:
- California omelette: bacon slices wrapped in an omelet with a sliced avocado on top, served with seasoned potatoes and choice of coffee cake or toast
- Hot Pastrami sandwich on a roll.  There were some bacon slices and cheese.  The seasoned fries were DELICIOUS, very seasoned and tasty.  Crispy, not soggy.
- Nutella french toast topped with mini marshmallows and graham crackers.  We thought this dish would be too sweet for one person's meal, so we shared.  Right amount of Nutella, it wasn't lacking.  Didn't even need to really dip in syrup bc it was sweet.  Only ate half of it.

Service was not the greatest, hence the 1 star deduction.  The coffee cake was never brought out, so we asked the waitress to pack it to-go for us.  We waited a while for the check.

I will definitely go back, but I hope the service is better.  If only this were Egg Works and they had that yellow egg on the table to notify servers when we need assistance.

On my visit I ordered several menu items with my kids, and everything was delicious. The service was attentive and spot-on! I would return to this location and recommend it. Most important to me, after great food, is how they treat their employees. Our server raved about how well they treated their employees and how he started washing dishes and worked his way up!

I love this restaurant it's so close to my house not a huge wait time during there busy hours, food is always consistent and very reasonable prices being located in summerlin.My favorite item is the Las Vegas style chicken sandwich with the house fries! For some odd reason I can't help but want that sandwich  every single time I'm here lol

This place is busy and it seems it's busy for a reason.

The wife and I swung by on a whim for breakfast at around 9:30am on a Friday.  After a brief wait we were taken to our table.  Our waitress was pretty quick to get to us and after a brief bit of confusion over the day's specials we had our food no more than 10 minutes later.

Our food was quite good.  I had the special -- a pizza-inspired scramble -- and my wife enjoyed her chili verde egg dish quite a bit.

Not that we're up for breakfast all that often, but if we are and feel like going out instead of eating in we'll consider returning to The Cracked Egg.

Good food, good atmosphere and fast service. The coffee cake was great! They had colored pencils for kids to keep busy. The signs and decorations were cute. We were staying at the red rock resort nearby and this was perfect for getting out and eating somewhere else.
Service was very good but the food took too long considering not many people in placem steak and eggs was weak for the price

They make the best feta egg white omelet. Its not too watery like another egg place in town.the service is fine (that's why I gave it 4 out 5 stars ).my breakfast was not cheap..
12.75$ with coffee plus tip.I enjoyed it.

An elevated Egg and I. Menu is pretty standard, the food is good and price point is good. The ambience was odd-seemed empty. Overall a decent place to grab breakfast. Service was ok, they seemed understaffed.

I always forget about this place when it's breakfast time. Finally remembered and was so happy that I did. We went on a Saturday morning, it was busy but we were seated right away. The waitress was super nice and brought our drinks right away.

There were 3 of us. We ordered a cheese, ham and mushroom omelette with seasoned potatoes and 2 orders of Chile Verde Rancheros" An open-faced corn tortilla with Black Beans, Seasoned Pork and Two Eggs any style. Topped with Chile Verde Salsa, Jack Cheese and Sour Cream. These came with seasoned potatoes or hash browns. We chose the potatoes.

The Chili Verde Rancheros were to die for. I loved it so much we went for breakfast again the next day. Ha! I never do that. When we went on Sunday we only had to wait about 5 minutes.

This is by far the best breakfast place I have been to. A great local choice. Can't wait to return, I can taste the Chili Verde right now.

Not only is the  menu so extensive, even the gluten free menu is extensive!  (Seriously - this place has a great GF menu.) The prices are super reasonable ($10 for the veggie scramble!) and the food is really good. This is more if you're in the mood for diner food/comfort food than if you're in the mood for fancy brunch, but I find myself always in the mood for the Home-y vibe and great food.

Service:  prompt and friendly.

Food: serving size was big but not too big.  Tasted nice.  Coffee was hot and well prepared.

Price:  Good for what you get.

Fav breakfast spot by far ! Vegas is kinda my 3rd home so i try to find places to eat and go every time i'm in town . i don't eat meat so it's hard to find places that cater to my kind as well as carnivores lol veggies for life

Had this  place bookmarked for a trip to Summerlin. A great, fun breakfast place. Had two delicious meals, breakfast of course. The staff is courteous and friendly. The place is clean and comfortable. Not to be missed.
Def the best place to eat breakfast in town. Always fast, always delicious, and everyone is always friendly. Prices are cheap for the quality that you get every single time!

Order the huevos rancheros sans sour cream mi amigo.  Cream makes it too rich as it is already drowning in queso.  I get this every time.  A sure flavor explosion mejicano style.  Make sure to chose the coffee cake as your side of carb if you want to reach a state of bliss.  Coffee usually not as solid as I like so you have to request multiple cups.  Spacey service but eh.  Share all this unless you are a lumberjack or want a food coma en route to your hike at Red Rock.

Our first trip & it was awesome! Our waitress, Cory, was super attentive and knowledgable of the menu. When I asked about the corned beef she assured me it was yummy and then went a step further and said if I didn't like it she would bring me something different! A+ customer service for sure. Honey had a "big bad wolf" omelette and it was perfect. The corned beef hash skillet was amazing - fresh cut corned beef cooked with the peppers, onions & potatoes. None of the greasy, overseasoning of most breakfast places. I did like the seasoned potatoes better than the hash browns. One of the highlights of this breakfast place was our toast. Pre-buttered, perfectly toasted bread & they had mixed fruit jelly. Truly awesome! If our next trip is this good, it will become a regular spot for us! 

Edit: too good to be true. 2nd visit. Our waitress, Natalie,  is awful. Dropped the check before she asked how we are doing. Slow on water refills. It's crowded again, but not too long a wait. Monte Cristo is terrible. Cheese isn't even melted. Both ham and chicken are still cold. I may just be spoiled by better sandwiches I've had other places, but the potatoes are on point. Honey had an omelette again, but the almost $3 up charge for sour cream and bell peppers is saddening. Our birthday girl had plain buttermilk pancakes & she is chomping away. Overall, I'm sad this place didn't live up to our expectations from our last visit & we won't be back any time soon. 

Gave it some time & gave them another try. This visit was much better. Coffee cake is great (red velvet) & our food was cooked perfectly. Our waitress, Andi, was great! Honey had the green scramble & he really liked it! Lots of veggies & th green sauce is awesome.

The overall attitude of this place seems catering to an elderly consumer base.  They don't offer wifi and this is explained by a sign that says "we don't have wifi, talk to eachother and pretend it's 1995, an obvious affront to younger more connected individuals who like to multitask while enjoying a morning meal.  

Our server seemed timid though he did well trying to personalize our guest experience.   it could be argued that the entire exchange was awkward and lacking a sunniness that one might find in someone with more experience.  We ordered our food and had to ask for more creamer, even though we placed the empty creamer container on the edge of the table.  

I ordered the low fat scramble and my partner ordered the veggie skillet.  I had the coffee cake as my bread and my partner ordered the sourdough toast.  

The lowfat scramble was actually delicious.  I would recommend ordering it with no salt.  This is how I ordered it and the dish was delectable!  There was chicken and tortilla chips which were not crispy because they were mixed into the scramble.  Not sure if they were meant to be crispy but it tasted good the way it was served.  The coffee cake was not very good at all.  It was actually a cherry jam coffee cake with white sugar frosting.  I wasn't expecting this for coffee cake in my limited experience is a plain sometimes cinnamon spiced pastry to sweeten your cup of Joe.  I would not recommend the coffee cake unless you are a fan of highly sugary items and cherries.  I am neither.

My partners skillet was the most lacking of the breakfast experience.  Again, it's hard to know what happened, whether the small differences were by design, the effect of a new or bad cook, or simply just a bad day in the history of the cracked egg.  For instance the seasoned potatoes were cold and seemed pre-made.  They were dark with seasoning even though I requested light seasoning.  The broccoli which came in the skillet was seemingly steamed, but the spinach was not.  So there was a mix of different cooking for all of the ingredients and it was off putting.    Also my toast was cooked fine.  

We ordered a waffle for the table and it came out soft and light. I wanted it cooked more but I didn't want to bother the waiter.  He asked the table next to us if they wanted their coffee to go, but once he gave us our check, he never once checked on us again.  We asked another of the wait staff if we could have our coffee to go and she brought us huge Styrofoam cups full of coffee.  Not what we asked for.  But still cool.  But a little excessive. But a nice gesture.  So anyways, we got a good experience in the end but not without some effort on our own part which somehow defeats the purpose of "service".   

When we finally told the hostess who was checking us out, she showed no remorse and offered no apology.  She just handed us our receipt and was over it.  Over all, we felt that the prices we paid did not reflect the quality of experience we received.  Too bad.

This is one of those places that should be your usual spot for breakfast or brunch.  Everything is the way I expected.  I ordered the build your own breakfast skillet and it is simply delicious.  I love their seasoned potatoes and of course, nothing can go wrong the the eggs.  I will go there again and again.

Tried the Cracked Egg in Summerlin today (close to home) the breakfast was good, my wife ordered the ruben nothing special. Decor is good, clean.
Overall just OK, I think if I'm going pay $10-$12 per breakfast I'm going to stick with the the Egg and I, or Bagel Cafe.

The service was great the food was not up to par I had a breakfast Mexican burrito it was not what I was expecting it was salty on the inside the hash browns were very orally I did not enjoy my breakfast
Great breakfast place with generous portions.   Service is just ok, especially since it wasn't too crowed.  Country potatoes are yummy!! Will be back

This location needs some serious fixing.  I walked in around 12:15. Table for one. I was greeted by the busser who took my drink order,  only to deliver half of a drink...really?? And then 2 male waiters who kept infoming me my waitress would be right with me. Around 12:25 she took my order and noticed my drink was empty. It was now 12:50 and still no drink refill no food no service just a bunch of eyeball waiters looking at me as if they were scared to aproach me and help a team member out  at 12:51 I walked out!!  Called the front to let them know I left due to...No drink, no silverware, no food and definitely no team work.  Hope they fix this problem.

Great place for an after ride revival! The staff went out of their way to get our larger group of hungry cyclists seated and served . I have to say... the service great and the plates  generous and tasty. Love the Sweet Potato Skillet!

Seriously this place is overrated. It is just a so-so breakfast/brunch spot. I took two groups of students out to breakfast on two different days and tried the waffles one morning and the omelet the next. I was not overly impressed and the students were polite enough not to complain and look a gift horse in the mouth, but no one (and this was a sample of over 12 meals) was raving about their food.  There are not many options outside the Red Rock, but if I ever go again I will definitely try to find something better.

This is easily the best breakfast spot in Vegas! They have a bunch of convenient locations around town and their food is amazing. We average one trip a week, and the service is always friendly and attentive. Both lunch and breakfast, we have never had a bad meal there!

On Tuesdays and Wednesdays they have Chicken Tortilla Soup on the menu. GET IT! It's quite possibly the best soup I've ever had!

It was okay. Portions are really big. The coffee cake was good. Had an omelet potatoes & croissant French toast. Potatoes were ok. Nothing special. The croissant French toast wasn't good. It was really flat too. We will be back for the omelet.

One of my favorite breakfast places in town. Food is always great. Servers are always busy but still give you the right amount of attention. South shore scramble is my every time meal. Loaded with bacon. (Get it without chicken it's better). Come here twice a month at least and always enjoyable. Any mistake in order usually comes from a busy kitchen but is fixed quick. Definitely refer for breakfast/brunch. Never order lunch but doesn't mean it's not just as good. :)

This review is a month over due.
This was may first time in this chain. I have seen these in San Antonio but never stopped.
We had a good breakfast.
When you go during the rush expect delay's like any place. Service was a bit slow but we had a wait for our table.
Since this is a chain I can only write about this location, but I hope to write about other locations in the future.
Everything had a good taste and I would definitely go to this location again.
Eggs cooked properly. Potatoes were good, seasoned just right.

Very disappointed with this Cracked Egg restaurant, the hostess passed us over and put another white couple in our booth.  When we questioned her she spoke so softly you could not hear her.  So we  had waiting longer to be seated . THATS , THAT WHITE ENTITLEMENT  BUT I AM TREAT AS IF I AM SECOND CLASS CITIZEN AND MY BUSINESS IS NOT IMPORTANT, WHY?
The manager was very apologetic, and offered to discount our meal.  She stated that this was her best hostess and this was her fault.   The manager and the waiter we had made the experience much better, and we will come back.  The manager came back to see how our meal was, it was great.  I appreciated that!

Haven't been seated yet but just a suggestion.... Maybe you shouldn't seat a party until the ENTIRE party is here. Been waiting for a table while 1 man sits at a 4 top waiting for the rest of his party to show... For the past ten minutes by the way.

Food was good, came out quickly. Love the spot its at. Only downfall was our waitress was horrible. She seemed like she didn't want to be there never checked on us, and just overall sucked. Other than that no complaints :)
Service was awesome! Thank you Amanda!!! She is the best sever ever!! Food was dank! I would come back in a heart beat

I think this place survives due to its location. Our third time here and the entrees don't look or taste like anything beyond what you can do in your own kitchen. The coffee cake isn't worth the calories. It tastes like a boxed mix over a layer of jam. I will say the servers are nice and prompt. The food isn't anything  to write home about.
Not bad. Service was decent, food was okay for the price. There are much better choices for breakfast. Great red velvet cinnamon roll though!

Always such a treat getting a quick simple and fresh breakfast here! My wife and I love this place ! Number one go to for breakfast and they have a few locations as well! Staff is always so great and attentive ! Good comes out quick and hot!
Food is decent quality.  Brunette hostess was very rude and ruined the experience.  She refused to smile and pretty much threw the pen at me to sign my receipt.

My favorite thing here is the coffee cake. They have different flavors all the time. It just depends on what they made the day you visit. I've never had one I didn't like. Today was cinnamon apple..my favorite so far. 
The menu has a wide variety of items. Everything is reasonably priced and the quantity is large. 
If there is a wait, don't be discouraged because it's worth the wait.

The Cracked Egg is always a solid choice for breakfast. Nothing outside the box here but you'll find a typical breakfast and lunch items to choose from.

Recently came lunch with some coworkers and was happy to have the option to select a breakfast entree to enjoy. The omelette was well-cooked and they accommodated all my requests.
Good food. Good service. Overall, just average for my taste buds. Had chicken fried steak and eggs. Gravy was good. Wife had tortilla Ranchero something or a rather. Again, not bad, but not great.
The food is alright, upset they do not serve any sort of Salon.. not too many healthy choices. Good for a quick breakfast.
Great food but really loud and crowded. This wouldn't be so bad if the support staff didn't seem overworked and overwhelmed.

Came here yesterday after our work out at lifetime fitness. It reminded me of egg works, but a bit more pricey. The ambienc was nice and we were sat right away which was good. The food was okay. I tried the eggs Benedict because that's my usual go to for breakfast. It was okay. I had to add a bit of pesto sauce for some flavor. The coffee cake was good when it was hot.
